result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scotty Tyler-Joseph Roberson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Scotty Tyler-Joseph Roberson not in court, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by video for Scotty Tyler-Joseph Roberson.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Scotty Tyler-Joseph Roberson not in court, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by video for Scotty Tyler-Joseph Roberson.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Calendar call held. Court cancels the stayed bench warrant. Defense counsel requests a scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Scotty Tyler-Joseph Roberson not in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Scotty Tyler-Joseph Roberson.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Pre-Trial Conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Case adjourned for a Calendar Call to Br 29.
Calendar call scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with AMJ.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.

Defendant Scotty Tyler-Joseph Roberson in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Scotty Tyler-Joseph Roberson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scotty Tyler-Joseph Roberson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
